DOC.brief_summary: This trial is conducted in Singapore. The aim of this trial is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of the study drug in healthy people and investigate how much of the study drug gets into the blood stream and how long it takes the body to get rid of it. Information about any side effects that may occur will also be collected.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of LY3025876 in Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Must be either a healthy male or a healthy female who cannot become pregnant Have a body mass index (BMI) of 18.5 to 40.0 kg/m^2, inclusive, at screening Are allergic to LY3025876 or related compounds Have a history of significant disease that may affect the actions of drugs or may pose a risk when taking the study medication Have a history of developing allergies, asthma, severe drug allergies (symptoms including, but not limited to, itching, red rashes, sores on the skin, scaling and shedding of skin), allergies or reactions to more than one drug, or have had bad reactions to skin creams containing corticosteroids. Corticosteroids are mainly used to control inflammation.
